@piiswrong Could you help to do a force merge?

Apache Jenkins server seems to be problematic. We are going to build our own server system. It isn’t possible to merge in since master is a github protected branch. Please try kicking off a new build with git commit —allow-empty -m”trigger build”
Or edit something here. Maybe merge in latest while you’re at it.
Should have been fixed by #8450. You may try upgrade to today's nightly build and see if it's fixed.
I think Model API is deprecated. Support for module is available through this API https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/versions/master/api/python/gluon/gluon.html#mxnet.gluon.HybridBlock.export

There are a few error messages linked to the installation of the dependent packages, such as igraph and DiagrammeR. Have you tried running `sudo make rpkg` ? Otherwise, you might try to execute the make rpkg steps once at a time to identify which fdirst steps result in error during install. 
I haven't encountered installation issue on both Ubuntu 14.04 and 16.04 with the current installation instructions at https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/get_started/install.html other than using  `sudo make rpkg` and ignoring the following `R CMD INSTALL mxnet_current_r.tar.gz`.

Actually all major framework does not synchronize mean and variance, since this will significantly slow down the training, if the cross bandwidth is low. That being said, i think this is a very useful feature. For semantic segmentation, especially reproducing PSPNet, synchronized batch norm is necessary.
So, How to implement it ?! @Jerryzcn  it seem that it's import for segmentation
@Tommymhz  I would suggest implement your own batchnorm in gluon, and sync across all gpus.
@novioleo let me try```I had nearly give mxnet up

Hi, from `incubator-mxnet/python/mxnet/gluon/model_zoo/vision/__init__.py`, they said

    Pretrained models are converted from torchvision.

and reference to [torchvision](http://pytorch.org/docs/master/torchvision/models.html), we can see that the pretrained models are trained on ImageNet.

@reminisce I add `waitall()` and it seem it's not image creation that take all the time but the forward pass

```python
Line #      Hits         Time  Per Hit   % Time  Line Contents
==============================================================
    20                                           @profile
    21                                           def main():
    22                                           
    23                                               # Load image
    24                                               # img = cv2.imread("data/test1.png")
    25         1         3638   3638.0      0.0      img = cv2.imread("data/test2.png")
    26         1          504    504.0      0.0      resized_img = transform_image(img)
    27                                           
    28                                               # Module API
    29         1         8470   8470.0      0.1      model = mx.mod.Module.load('model/test', 101, context=mx.cpu(0), data_names=['data'])
    30         1        19996  19996.0      0.1      model.bind(data_shapes=[('data', (1, 3, 200, 200))])
    31                                           
    32         1            4      4.0      0.0      tic = time.time()
    33        11           15      1.4      0.0      for i in range(10):
    34        10        10505   1050.5      0.1          mx.ndarray.waitall()
    35        10         3939    393.9      0.0          image = mx.io.DataBatch(data=(mx.nd.array(resized_img), ), label=(mx.nd.array(['1']),))
    36        10           52      5.2      0.0          mx.ndarray.waitall()
    37        10         1490    149.0      0.0          model.forward(image)
    38        10     12653490 1265349.0     92.7          mx.ndarray.waitall()
    39        10          762     76.2      0.0          prob = model.get_outputs(0)[0][0][0]
    40        10          670     67.0      0.0          print(type(prob))  #  <class 'mxnet.ndarray.ndarray.NDArray'>
    41        10           69      6.9      0.0          prob.wait_to_read()
    42        10       101569  10156.9      0.7          top1 = mx.nd.argmax(prob, axis=0)[0].asnumpy()[0]
    43        10          394     39.4      0.0          print('Prediction :', top1)
    44         1           63     63.0      0.0      print("Prediction time : %.6fs" % (time.time() - tic))
    45                                           
    46                                           
    47                                               # Amalgamation
    48         1            2      2.0      0.0      tic = time.time()
    49         1            3      3.0      0.0      sys.path.append('/home/dev/lib/mxnet/amalgamation/python/')
    50         1         7952   7952.0      0.1      from mxnet_predict import Predictor, load_ndarray_file
    51         1           95     95.0      0.0      model = Predictor(open('model/test-symbol.json', "r").read(),
    52         1         2592   2592.0      0.0                      open('model/test-0101.params', "rb").read(),
    53         1        13413  13413.0      0.1                      {'data': (1, 3, 200, 200)})
    54        11           27      2.5      0.0      for i in range(10):
    55        10         3675    367.5      0.0          model.forward(data=resized_img)
    56        10       813716  81371.6      6.0          prob = model.get_output(0)[0]
    57        10          751     75.1      0.0          print(type(prob))  #  <class 'numpy.ndarray'>
    58        10          125     12.5      0.0          top1 = np.argmax(prob)
    59        10         1223    122.3      0.0          print('Prediction :', top1)
    60         1           29     29.0      0.0      print("Prediction time : %.6fs" % (time.time() - tic))
```

i think i get it now.
Because LogisticRegressionOutput is only one input ,it has to modify some metric code ,
It fixed now.

Thank you @ahong007007 . i want to extract the informationfrom every layer from mxnet cnn.
I thought out one way, but encounter a difficulty at one step. Here is what I did.
I found all the trained cnn's parameters in model$arg.params , and to compute with parameters we can use mx.nd... founctions as bellow:

`    conv1_result<- mxnet::mx.nd.Convolution(data=mx.nd.array(train_array),weight=model$arg.params$convolution0_weight,bias=model$arg.params$convolution0_bias,kernel=c(8,8),num_filter = 50)
str(conv1_result)
tanh1_result<-mx.nd.Activation(data= conv1_result, act_type = "sigmoid")
pool1_result <- mx.nd.Pooling(data = tanh1_result, pool_type = "avg", kernel = c(4,4), stride = c(4,4))
#conv2 result
conv2_result<- mxnet::mx.nd.Convolution(data=pool1_result,weight=model$arg.params$convolution1_weight,bias=model$arg.params$convolution1_bias,kernel=c(5,5),num_filter = 50)
str(conv1_result)
tanh2_result<-mx.nd.Activation(data= conv1_result, act_type = "sigmoid")
pool2_result <- mx.nd.Pooling(data = tanh1_result, pool_type = "avg", kernel = c(4,4), stride = c(4,4))

#
# 1st fully connected layer result
flat_result <- mx.nd.flatten(data = pool2_result)
fcl_1_result <- mx.nd.FullyConnected(data = flat_result,weight = model$arg.params$fullyconnected0_weight,bias = model$arg.params$fullyconnected0_bias, num_hidden = 500)
tanh_3_result <- mx.nd.Activation(data = fcl_1_result, act_type = "tanh")
# 2nd fully connected layer result
fcl_2_result <- mx.nd.FullyConnected(data = tanh_3,weight = model$arg.params$fullyconnected1_weight,bias = model$arg.params$fullyconnected1_bias, num_hidden =100)`

but when I came to mx.nd.FullyConnected() step , I encountered not sufficient memory(i have 16 GB RAM) and R crashed.
So, does anyone know how to batch_size the input data in mx.nd.FullyConnected(), or any method to make mx.nd.FullyConnected() run successfully as  mx.model.FeedForward.create() did?
Yeah weird, a colleague told me his PR went through. But this failed already twice for me, with the same error. I try another force push.
Rebased to trigger CI.
Don't update submodules
You are updating nnvm with this PR. Try removing that.

@piiswrong @szha @sbodenstein MKL-DNN now officially supports OSX. So, we don't need to worry about this issue.
https://github.com/01org/mkl-dnn/releases/tag/v0.11

Sorry, I am getting real confused with these different repos. I now have nnvm at commit
8d79cfd0b42fbe9f6ad75886d495065d5500b9dd.

If you can point out a workflow for updating my local branch (I usually just do a rebase, clearly this seems not enough if the other repos change?), I'd not mess this up in the future.
If any of these double overloads are removed, there's a unit test that will fail, correct?

I met the similar issue on Oracle Linux 6. The main problem I guess is that the version of opencv is too low. They does not even have the opencv2 directory...instead, all files are in dir called 'opencv'
I am trying again.
Will fp16 used for all keys? Do we consider the case where we only want to use fp16 for a particular key?
Thanks for all your replies.  I found out that this is an issue with the internal R installation and not  mxnet.

@cjolivier01 My new unit tests should indeed fail if functions for DType = double are not computed in double, but in float. Even though this is not guaranteed (but I've seen it happen for some).

Is that what you mean?

The tests simply compare ours against NumPy. It is not really clear what NumPy is doing for DType not equal to float or double. So the tests for float16 have to be taken with a grain of salt.

But I do not know of better ones

@piiswrong I think it's inrrelavent to fix in #8322

1. In current way, I think the class kvstore_dist is just like class DistServerWrapper mentioned above. We pass the data type to kvstore_dist first, and then create kvstore_dist_server in the function 'RunServer'.
2. I think merge the logic in '_init_kvstore_server_module' to the function 'kvstore.create' may be a better way to start server and worker.

```
from kvstore_server import KVStoreServer

def create(name='local', data_type='float32'):
    if not isinstance(name, string_types):
        raise TypeError('name must be a string')
    handle = KVStoreHandle()
    check_call(_LIB.MXKVStoreCreate(c_str(name), c_str(data_type),
                                    ctypes.byref(handle)))
    kv = KVStore(handle)
    is_worker = ctypes.c_int()
    check_call(_LIB.MXKVStoreIsWorkerNode(ctypes.byref(is_worker)))
    if is_worker.value == 0:
        server = KVStoreServer(kv )
        server.run()
        sys.exit()
    return kv
```
